_meanings:
(<ab>Nom.</ab> <ab>sing.</ab> {#uSanA#}; <ab>Voc.</ab> <ab>sing.</ab>  
{#uSanan, uSana, uSanaH#}) <ab>N.</ab> of Śukra, 
regent of the planet Venus, son of
Bhṛgu and preceptor of the Asuras.
In the Vedas he has the epithet
{%Kāvya%} given to him, probably 
because he was noted for his wisdom;
<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Bg. 10. 37</ls>; {#kavInAmuSanA kaviH#}. He is
also known as a writer on civil
and religious law (<ls>Y. 1. 4</ls>), and
as an authority on civil polity;
{#SAstramuSanasA praRItaM#} <ls>Pt. 5</ls>;  
{#aDyApitasyoSanasApi nItiM#} <ls>Ku. 3. 6.</ls>
